data.title: Fill the Silos
data.statement: When a grain truck arrives with [[N]] bushels of grain, you must decide how to distribute the incoming grain among the [[S]] silos to fill them as evenly as possible given their current contents [[C]], a string of numbers separated by spaces.  <<Empty silos are not listed in [[C]] and their distributions should be placed at the end of the output.>>
data.stubGenerator:
STATEMENT
N: Incoming grain
S: Number of silos
C: Quantity of grain in each silo

read N:int
read S:int
read C:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: [[N]] - Number of bushels arriving
<<Line 2>>: [[S]] - Number of silos
<<Line 3>>: [[C]] - A <<String>> containing space separated <<Integers>> indicating the amount of grain in the non-empty silos.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: A <<String>> of [[S]] space separated <<integers>> giving how many bushels of the incoming grain should be distributed to each silo.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

When a grain truck arrives with N bushels of grain, you must decide how to distribute the incoming grain among the S silos to fill them as evenly as possible given their current contents C, a string of numbers separated by spaces. Empty silos are not listed in C and their distributions should be placed at the end of the output.
Input
Line 1: N - Number of bushels arriving
Line 2: S - Number of silos
Line 3: C - A String containing space separated Integers indicating the amount of grain in the non-empty silos.
Output
Line 1: A String of S space separated integers giving how many bushels of the incoming grain should be distributed to each silo.
Constraints
0 ≤ N ≤ 1500
1 ≤ S ≤ 10
0 ≤ C ≤ 10,000, length at least 1
There is only one correct answer for the inputs given. Test cases have no grain left over.
Example
Input
100
2
100 70
Output
35 65
